#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Wikinews interviews Australian Paralympic assistant coach David Gould
#Text=Thursday , July 25 , 2013
#Text=2000 Australian Paralympic
#Text=Team portrait of David Gould .
#Text=He has not changed a bit since then .
#Text=Image : Australian Paralympic Committee .

#Text=Wikinews caught up with Australian wheelchair basketball coach David Gould in Canberra , where the Australia women 's national wheelchair basketball team — the Gliders — were having a training camp .
#Text=Gould told Wikinews he retired from playing after the 2002 World Championships .
#Text=He said he began coaching able bodied basketball at schools and clubs in South Australia .
#Text=He was awarded a scholarship by Basketball Australia and the Australian Sports Commission , and became assistant coach of the Under 23 Men 's team in November 2011 .
#Text=He is now national wheelchair skills coach , assistant coach of the men 's and women 's national teams , and coach of the Under 23 Men 's and Under 25 Women 's teams .
#Text=He noted the Gliders have another training camp coming up in Brisbane in August .
#Text=This is to be an open development camp any player can attend .
#Text=Twelve players are to be selected for the Asia Oceania Zone ( AOZ ) Wheelchair Basketball Championships in Bangkok in November .
#Text=The top three teams then qualify for the World Championships , to be held in Canada next year .
#Text=He is acutely aware the Gliders have never won a World Championship or a Paralympics .
#Text=But he has won a gold medal , with the men 's team , the Rollers , in Atlanta in 1996 .
#Text=" We went on a tour of the United States beforehand " , he recalled .
#Text=Facing the United States in the United States was daunting .
#Text=There was a huge crowd .
#Text=So how did they do it ?
#Text=" We had confidence in ourselves , and stuck to our plan , " he recalled .
#Text=This , he said , is what he and Glider 's head coach Tom Kyle are trying to teach the Gliders .
#Text=To believe in the process .
#Text=They take them out of their comfort zone , show them the right techniques , the right way to do things .
#Text=The idea is to get the principles right .
#Text=Gould told Wikinews they have to look not just to the 2016 Summer Paralympics in Rio in 2016 , but further ahead to 2020 .
#Text=They have to recruit new players and develop them .
#Text=He said he took a Gliders team to the Osaka Cup with only four members of the 2012 team , in order to give members of the development team experience with international competition .
#Text=He set up a mentor system whereby the six newcomers were each paired with one of the old hands .
#Text=Wikinews was shown how the games are videoed and critiqued by the coaches .
#Text=Special software allows the videos to be edited .
#Text=Effects such as circling players can be added , along with captions and audio from the coaches .
#Text=The edited video can then be downloaded by the players .
#Text=Gould said there is a weekly video conference with the players .
#Text=He considered video of other teams is an important training tool .
#Text=He noted the Gliders had to play Brazil in the first match of the Paralympics in London , which was very tough , because so little was known about them .
#Text=As it turned out , Brazil has a great program , and he thinks it could be a contender in front of a home crowd in Rio in 2016 .
#Text=Wikinews noted one of the Gliders , Amber Merritt , had her arm in a sling .
#Text=Gould said her arm had been scanned , and the doctors will make their evaluation .
#Text=Like most elite athletes , he knows about injury first hand .
#Text=He told Wikinews he had injured his shoulder during the 2000 Olympics , and had to have it operated on afterwards .
#Text=He said he did not want players playing injured , and sometimes it was better just to lose a week if you have the flu .
#Text=He expected his players to be honest and up front with themselves , their coaches and their team .
#Text=" We need everyone on the same page " , he told Wikinews .
#Text=Gould told Wikinews the Asia Oceania Zone championships will feature Australia , Japan , China , Thailand , South Korea , and perhaps Hong Kong .
#Text=The venue in Bangkok is well known to him , as the U23 Men 's team have already played there .
#Text=His plan is to arrive early , to allow the players to acclimatise to the high humidity and the food .
#Text=Some of the U23 men got sick .
#Text=He does not expect difficulty qualifying , but it is " one of the I 's that have to be dotted and T 's that have to be crossed .
